channel.title: Netbeans issue
channel.description:
Hey guys, could someone tell me how to run a server on netbeans? i haven't got a clue.. lol
thank you in advance

item.title: Netbeans issue
item.dc:creator: @Bl3nd Bl3nd
item.description:
@Bl3nd wrote:

Java project, then when it asks for a name for the project, that might have a check box, uncheck the box then browse where your server files are.
I’m not sure if this works in NetBeans though, I’m just assuming its close to the way you do it in Eclipse.

Read full topic

item.title: Netbeans issue
item.dc:creator: @sertan8 sertan8
item.description:
@sertan8 wrote:

[quote=“Pure_, post:3, topic:541499”]Create a new project, drag in your source files, drag your data files to the project folder then click the debug arrow towards the top of the window. I would advise you read their start-up tutorial.

[quote author=falconpunch777 link=topic=660369.msg4415484#msg4415484 date=1395705719]
Everyone uses Eclipse. I’d advise to use Eclipse.
[/quote]Do you get off at posting useless posts?[/quote]

I’m pressing on new project, but what should I do next? java application? NVM got it working

Read full topic

item.description:
@RUNE-PK wrote:

Everyone uses Eclipse. I’d advise to use Eclipse.
